title: MorganaX
author: MorganaX
content: Many Nigerians are used to online banks and funny to say online banks gets more customers than banks like Firstbank, Access bank e.t.c. So my question is that is online bank good? Is it safe? These are the questions I ask and some people normally ask. Many people don’t like online because it doesn’t have any office you can run to in case of any issues. Can it get hacked?I would actually say yes it can get hacked. It’s very easy to hack online banks. If the phone gets missing, can you block the account?No, if your phone gets missing and you’re using an online bank it will be easily hacked or they can easily take all your money while other banks, if you’re phone or ATM card gets missing you can go to their office and lay a complain and they will close down the account or card.

comments.author: Samlucky O
comments.body: Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMCan it get hacked?Yes it can be hacked. talking about hacking I think it's applicable to both normal banking system and online banking too. Because there has been several occasions of hacks from bank over the years and most of it is as a result of carelessness of the owner of the account. For example leaving your account information on your phone without locking your phone can be implicating. Sometimes we should completely remove things that will implicate us by deleting bank security detail on phone. rather write it on paper and keep in a safe place, in other not to get hacked when your phone get missing or when we release our phones to people. Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMIf the phone gets missing, can you block the account?No,I think you can call there customer support center. Even if they don't have branches does not mean that dey can not attend to there costumers when it comes to security. I think when dealing with online banking we should deal with those that has license or CBN approval just like opay. Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMif your phone gets missing and you’re using an online bank it will be easily hacked or they can easily take all your money while other banks, if you’re phone or ATM card gets missing you can go to their office and lay a complain and they will close down the account or card.One important thing you should know is that online banking system should not be a place to put all your funds, it is just like an alternative to banking system incase there is a network issue in normal bank you can run mini transaction on it like pay bills, recharge cards, buy data and some other things but no to put all your funds in. But I don't think hacking online account is possible just as i said earlier. It depends on how secured you are on releasing your privacy.

comments.author: Judith87403
comments.body: For now online banking is actually the best and besides with the rapid growth of technology it has greatly reduced the ways at which most of the things are being done especially the banking system because unlike those days were all transactions and savings are mostly done on the bank and in those days even if you have some money it takes you time for you to open an account do to some certain requirements and if you are unable to provide those documents you automatically not going to be allowed on opening an account, and also with the current development on the banking system this days were as you will need to queue up until it gets to your turn before you can either withdraw or meet the customer service. But with the help of online banking people were able to navigate to other easier ways of banking so online banking has really improve a lot of things.

comments.author: Obim34
comments.body: For me, I see nothing wrong with online banking as it has made my daily transactions stress free and easy to use. We all were  withness during the cashless era this online banks were the mostly used as most busines men did their huge daily transaction with this online banks like the OPay and PalmPay.This online banks are licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and all trustworthy to use. Being licensed by CBN means the government has done close research and have their eyes on them incase they try to fraud.I also believe with time this online banks will soon develop into having their own office, I heard something about Opay already working on that, so have no fears doing transactions with them.Yes, there is every tendency of them getting hacked but it is as low as that of any other Banks getting hacked.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Op I think all banks operate online and if you are referring to microfinance ban then I will they very good to use. These online banks more faster than their counterparts. When you have problem with these online banks and you contact the customer care service their response is is much more faster than the offline customer care service in the banking hall. In the banking hall, they will waste your time for unnecessary things. But for online banks they will go straight to the main point and solve your problem. They are agents for the online microfinance banks which they use to attend customers in their various offices across the country. No bank is from hacking. But the firewall of the site will determine the security of the site. They can't be hacked. Their security is tight.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: Online bank is all about convenience and additional features it provides which an traditionally banks don't offer. This exists in India as well and they not only help you with your transactions but also helps with expense trackers and keep you updated on your spending trend and provides more insight which traditionally banks don't offer. They have customer care helpline where you can reachout in case of losing mobile & even if you lose mobile the person who finds it cannot access your account without the passcode which would be similar to ATM withdrawal or net banking. Security risks or risks of getting hacked will always be there as it's upto us how we maintain and safeguard our sensitive information.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMMany Nigerians are used to online banks and funny to say online banks gets more customers than banks like Firstbank, Access bank e.t.c. So my question is that is online bank good? Is it safe? These are the questions I ask and some people normally ask. Many people don’t like online because it doesn’t have any office you can run to in case of any issues. How you go talk like that, I just do some rough browsing and Access bank get around 50 million plus customers while Opay wey be the highest fintech bank get around 40 million plus customer. Judging by their years of existence, Opay dun do well pass Access bank but other fintech aren't doing close to those numbers so although online banks dey do very well dem never take over the physical banks completely but they're on the path of doing just that. For this topic, yes online banks are good but just as I talk for a similar thread, make we no just close eye dey use this banks or apps them. You know that talk wey dem dey say when eating with the devil use a long spoon, na wetin we suppose dey do here.Everything wey you fit do for offline banks you can do with online banks and even more so your argument no stand here. Online banks are good and they're doing Nigerian a big favour especially cryptocurrency traders because without them eh the kind lack of trust wey for full P2P exchange and spoil the whole thing for us due to poor network for be problem. All banks can be hacked so this one no be points but if you put in some external security measures you fit avoid all those worries wey you dey get. Fintech Banks are just better than our traditional banks that's the fact.

comments.author: Spaceman1000$

It’s very easy to hack online banks. If the phone gets missing, can you block the account?No, if your phone gets missing and you’re using an online bank it will be easily hacked or they can easily take all your money while other banks, if you’re phone or ATM card gets missing you can go to their office and lay a complain and they will close down the account or card.When you talk about the online banking I believe you're referring to fin-tech companies, which I believe are duly licensed by NDIC to operate some financial transactions, remember they are not allowed to run all financial transactions, like operating a pension scheme, and some large corporate accounts. Also, all accounts can be hacked, if the owners of those accounts misplace some vital details of those accounts to scammers or fraudsters wether is an online account or a regular commercial bank account it doesn't matter.

comments.author: Mayor of ogba
comments.body: Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMMany Nigerians are used to online banks and funny to say online banks gets more customers than banks like Firstbank, Access bank e.t.c. So my question is that is online bank good? Is it safe? These are the questions I ask and some people normally ask. Many people don’t like online because it doesn’t have any office you can run to in case of any issues. Op, have you researched to conclude that fintech banks have more customers than commercial banks? With banks like GTB, Access bank, First bank, and Zenith Bank you can still carry out online banking with them. Fintech bank like Opay is good to use due to their low charge, and convenience, and they are licensed by the CBN and insured by NDIC. Since fintech banks are yet to establish a physical office where their customers can lay a complain you can just use them to receive money, after receiving the money you move the money to your main bank account in case anything happens, it will not affect you. QuoteCan it get hacked?I would actually say yes it can get hacked. It’s very easy to hack online banks. All banks can be hacked. Once you expose your login details to scammers or fraudsters your bank account will be hacked and you will lose your money be it our traditional bank or fintech bank. Do not keep your banking App as always login so that if you misplace your phone someone else will not get access to your account through your banking App. QuoteIf the phone gets missing, can you block the account?No, if your phone gets missing and you’re using an online bank it will be easily hacked or they can easily take all your money while other banks, if you’re phone or ATM card gets missing you can go to their office and lay a complain and they will close down the account or card.If your Opay ATM card goes missing you can block the ATM card with your Opay account. Just call Opay customer service they will direct you on how to block your Opay ATM card with your Opay App. Even in our traditional banks, if your phone goes missing and you don't act fast you will lose your money if the phone falls into the wrong hands.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Na for this part of our world we still they doubt online banking but even as you take testify now, many people Don they move to online banking because E sure pass and e even get more guarantee pass in terms of flexibility, usability and efficiency. I think the only aspect you may not be comfortable with is the reliability which is because you go talk say them no get physical office and if them hack their server for instance, how you fit reclaim back your savings, yeah?Now before you go fit operate an online banking, e no be easy thing and na why you go find out say no be every Tom, Dick and Harry they fit run am. As you they see say the traditional banking difficult, na so online banking be in terms of establishment and management.Now before you go fit establish an online banking for Nigeria, you for suppose make sure say you understand and comply with the regulatory requirements wey CBN they set for the banks. You fit check this document wey carry the heading  “Guidelines on Electronic Banking in Nigeria”, you go understand say no be just like that them they establish but they must to follow due processes too to get approval.Aside CBN own, NIBSS too get their own “Legal and Regulatory Framework of Electronic Payment Systems” amongst other regulatory frameworks wey you go suppose follow to establish and manage your online or electronic banking platform for Nigeria. These bodies they always update their list and frameworks and if those online banks no meet up, them go ban them come restrict people from patronizing them.This mean to say that those banks must also be fully equipped and up to park with the technological infrastructure and security measures of the platforms. So, for instance, if people fit raise eyebrows on the secure of a banking platform now, it won't take a time before the bank will be shut down. More importantly, there will be a deposit of capital and commitment made by the company to be able to get started.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: Online banks de very fast and convenient, you fit to rely on dem to do your transactions without any issues. Dem be new technology to take make financial transactions very easy, infact I believe say dem go de make our regular traditional banks to de seat up for dem services. Aside from dat, personally na to do fast transactions for online banks and transfer my money go for my traditional bank account. I never fully trust these new online banks finish, dem de be me like exchanges for cryptocurrency matter, do your transactions and transfer your coins for your none custodial wallets. With time my trust level for dem side fit to increase, but for now na to do fast transactions for dem side and transfer to my regular bank account.

So thinking that online bank are unsafe due to security breach is just a silly excuse, because I believe even the commercial banks can be hack and before now that online banks were not this popular, many people and I have witnessed many myself, have complianed that someone hack their account and sometimes it may be to the ignorance of the owner of account. comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMMany Nigerians are used to online banks and funny to say online banks gets more customers than banks like Firstbank, Access bank e.t.c. So my question is that is online bank good? Is it safe? These are the questions I ask and some people normally ask. Many people don’t like online because it doesn’t have any office you can run to in case of any issues. I will say that online banks are good and they have helped a lot of people when the physical banks network are on downtime for a long time. They pay more attention to their networks than physical banks and this has made many people to switch to using them than the physical banks we have in the country today. About their safety, they all claim that they are safe but the words of mouth isn’t enough to back their claim of safety that they are assuring their customers with. Don’t leave money in them for too long or use it as your savings account, that’s the best practice to apply if you’re use to using the online banks.QuoteIf the phone gets missing, can you block the account?No, if your phone gets missing and you’re using an online bank it will be easily hacked or they can easily take all your money while other banks, if you’re phone or ATM card gets missing you can go to their office and lay a complain and they will close down the account or card.Some of the online banks now make use of USSD code that you can use to access your account without the bank application in your phone. If your phone is stolen, you can renew your sim and immediately block the account from your phone. The security of the banks are increasing that I am sure of, but you can’t totally depend on them. Whatever you want to use them for, try and trade carefully to avoid disappointments. I love using them more than the physical banks we have even when CBN is giving them hard time to operate in the country now.

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: Quote from: MorganaX on December 14, 2023, 09:40:11 PMSo my question is that is online bank good? Is it safe? These are similar questions to the ones asked by people who doubt bitcoins. Is bitcoin safe? Is it good? where is their office?But the truth is that online banks are actually an advancement from the normal banks, an since it is new, it will be suspected as unsafe and not good to use by many people who are rigid and not easy to accept change. Not all online banks are safe, but there are some that are doing very well, and are showing signs that will be better with improvement as time goes on.

comments.author: Makus
comments.body: Op me I stand for online banks oo, because na wattin I dey use especially for this period wey network dey disturb small small, na them be the only alternative to save u from being stranded, though Dem fit get hacked easily if the hacker hold your sim card but this one sef still apply for normal traditional banks. All of them fit get hacked so e come dey even be like say na online bank sef naim good pass, according to the point wey baba brianboss out for ground, the only thing na be say, e nor dey advisable to put enough moni for inside, like millions of naira, you fit put less than a million if you ready to spend am immediately, but if you wan spend am immediately naim you fit put the amount of million provided say your account go fit carry am without any shaking.

comments.author: odunybiz
comments.body: Online banks are good as they are highly fast and convenient when compare to physical banks. What I can say if one isn't get convince by online bank and still wish to use them is that he/she can use them with care. Such people should only deposit money they wish to use in few days or weeks there and use a physical bank for huge money deposit. I have a lot of friends who operates with online banks that way.

comments.author: Y3shot
comments.body: Online banking is fast in transaction compare to other traditional banks, the online banks network are always good, low charge fee or no charge fee compare to the traditional banks but I won't advice anyone to save a huge amount of money in an online bank because this banks doesn't have office or branches in every location or region. If anything happens to this bank it will be difficult to get the this online banks in physical,  people just need to save little amount of money in this bank.

When something doesn't give much problem like that I see no reason for calling customer care except the case is a serious one.
